titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John W. Holland Letters, 1859-1876
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Correspondence among members of a family in North Carolina, Virginia, the Midwest and the Southwest. The letters describe the trip west; prices in western states; and the political and racial situation in Abbeville County, S.C., 1876.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: John W. Holland letters, 1859-1876, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: John W. Holland was a resident of Lexington (Davidson County), North Carolina.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Correspondence among members of a family in North Carolina, Virginia, the Midwest and the Southwest. The letters describe the trip west; prices in western states; and the political and racial situation in Abbeville County, S.C., 1876.
